"WHAT IS TELEHEALTH??? Well to put it simply, it's an amazing new resource that allows your student to be seen virtually, by a licensed healthcare provider while at school. Linked below is the information and required forms that need to be filled out in order to participate in telehealth this year. The first page contains a link to complete the forms online or on a tablet or smartphone. Be sure to complete all the necessary forms to be eligible for telehealth services. The forms may also be printed and returned to Nurse Jaci at school. Feel free to reach out if you have any questions or concerns."

post_text:
We are happy to announce that thanks to a waiver from the U.S. Dept. of Agriculture, beginning September 3, 2020, all students in the Poyen School District will be able to receive breakfast and lunch FREE of charge. This waiver will be in effect until January 1, 2021. Even though everyone can eat for free, we still need every household to turn in a free and reduced lunch application. Every application turned in helps the school funding tremendously. Use the link to access the free and reduced form. If you need a paper copy please let us know. Elementary:501-332-5529 High School: 501-332-2939
https://www.poyenschool.com/289433_2

post_text: Due to the Covid-19 summer guidelines, we are unable to have an Open House this year. We regret this because Open House has become an important tradition at Poyen School that marks the start of a new school year. Returning students will get "back to school" information that would normally be given out at the open house on the school's website by August 20th. We will also have a new student orientation on August 20th from 5:00-7:00 pm. This will be for the families of new students to a building(kindergartens and 7th graders) and new students to the district to tour the buildings and meet their teachers. Masks will be required for anyone attending the new student orientation.

This will be for the families of new students to a building(kindergartens and 7th graders) and new students to the district to tour the buildings and meet their teachers. Masks will be required for anyone attending the new student orientation.

post_text:
Just a reminder that if you have not already done so, please fill out the survey linked below to choose a learning option for the 2020-2021 school year.

https://bit.ly/poyen20survey

Poyen Public Schools is actively planning for student re-engagement this fall. This survey is required for all students. Your response to this survey is critical to plan for students to be safe and receive a rich educational experience.
This survey needs to be filled out by July 20, 2020, for each student. (If you have three students, you will need to complete the survey three times.)
There are two learning models for the 2020-2021 school year.
Blended Learning(on-site) - Students will be on campus and have face to face instruction with some digital learning components that will allow for a smooth transition to remote learning if needed.
Virtual Learning(off-site)- Students will have online instruction provided through the school by a digital content provider. Access to efficient internet is necessary for your child to have a successful virtual education.

post_text:
Grant County Summer Feeding Program

The Grant County Summer Feeding Program will provide breakfast and lunch for seven days for children under the age of 18. Meals can be delivered three days a week or picked up at Sheridan High School.

If you would like to receive meals, send an email to sheridansfp@gmail.com with your name, phone number, address, and the number of children under 18 in the home.

Poyen Elementary School
May 4 at 11:23 AM ¬∑

On May 6th, 7th, and 8th we will have a drive-thru pickup for students to pick up their personal items from Poyen elementary school. We have collected all items, including 3rd 9-weeks report cards, spring pictures, graduation pictures, etc and put them into backpacks. Please park in front of the elementary building, stay in your car, and we will bring the backpack out to you. The times are listed below. If none of these will work for you, let us know and we can make other arrangements. Please call the office at 501-332-5529 if you have any questions.

Wednesday, May 6th - 8:00-3:00
Thursday, May 7th - 8:00 -3:00 and 6:00-7:00
Friday, May 8th - 8:00-3:00

post_text: Food deliveries this week will be made on Tuesday, April 21st.

post_text:
Dear Poyen Community,

The end of each school year is typically filled with many celebratory events (prom, banquets, graduation, etc.). Unfortunately, these events will not occur at their regularly scheduled time for the remainder of the 2019-2020 academic year.

We know celebrating our students‚Äô successes is a highlight for our school and community, and our administration is working together to explore options as we bring closure to the school year. We will be reaching out to our seniors soon through the Remind app for input to help guide and shape our decisions regarding graduation.

Thank you for all you do to support the Poyen School District.

Sincerely,

Poyen Administration
text:
Dear Poyen Community,

The end of each school year is typically filled with many celebratory events (prom, banquets, graduation, etc.). Unfortunately, these events will not occur at their regularly scheduled time for the remainder of the 2019-2020 academic year.

We know celebrating our students‚Äô successes is a highlight for our school and community, and our administration is working together to explore options as we bring closure to the school year. We will be reaching out to our seniors soon through the Remind app for input to help guide and shape our decisions regarding graduation.

Thank you for all you do to support the Poyen School District.

Sincerely,

Poyen Administration

post_text:
Attention PARENTS & STUDENTS:

Mrs. Coker, our school counselor, would like to connect with students through the Remind app. You can read about this texting service here: www.remind.com.

If you are a 7th grader, join by sending a text message to 81010 and in the message type: @poyen2025

If you are an 8th grader, join by sending a text message to 81010 and in the message type: @poyen2024

If you are a 9th grader, join by sending a text message to 81010 and in the message type: @poyen2023

If you are a 10th grader, join by sending a text message to 81010 and in the message type: @poyen2022

If you are an 11th grader, join by sending a text message to 81010 and in the message type: @poyen2021

If you are a 12th grader, join by sending a text message to 81010 and in the message type: @poyen2020

text:
Attention PARENTS & STUDENTS:

Mrs. Coker, our school counselor, would like to connect with students through the Remind app. You can read about this texting service here: www.remind.com.

If you are a 7th grader, join by sending a text message to 81010 and in the message type: @poyen2025

If you are an 8th grader, join by sending a text message to 81010 and in the message type: @poyen2024

If you are a 9th grader, join by sending a text message to 81010 and in the message type: @poyen2023

If you are a 10th grader, join by sending a text message to 81010 and in the message type: @poyen2022

If you are an 11th grader, join by sending a text message to 81010 and in the message type: @poyen2021

If you are a 12th grader, join by sending a text message to 81010 and in the message type: @poyen2020

post_text: After several confirmed cases of flu, I am encouraging everyone to remain diligent with the school's sickness policy. PLEASE do not send your kids to school when they are ill, as this compromises the health and safety of ALL students and faculty members. Our custodial staff is working extra hard to make sure our campus and classrooms are clean and disinfected each day, but your help is also needed at home. Encourage your kids to wash their hands regularly and to cover their mouth when they cough or sneeze with their elbow or a tissue to greatly reduce the number of germs that are spread to people and objects around them. If your child is diagnosed with the flu, please contact me so that I can accurately report the impact of influenza in our district to the Arkansas Department of Health. Nurse Jaci
text: After several confirmed cases of flu, I am encouraging everyone to remain diligent with the school's sickness policy. Our custodial staff is working extra hard to make sure our campus and classrooms are clean and disinfected each day, but your help is also needed at home. Encourage your kids to wash their hands regularly and to cover their mouth when they cough or sneeze with their elbow or a tissue to greatly reduce the number of germs that are spread to people and objects around them. If your child is diagnosed with the flu, please contact me so that I can accurately report the impact of influenza in our district to the Arkansas Department of Health. Nurse Jaci

If you have any questions please contact the superintendent's office at 501-332-8884.

post_text:
The snow this week has served as a reminder that winter weather season is upon us. Be sure you have signed up for the district‚Äôs text and phone call alerts. This will be the fastest way to hear about school closures due to winter weather. If you have not signed up visit the link below.

https://www.poyenschool.com/402648_3

The district was approved for 5 Alternate Methods of Instruction(AMI) Days. AMI Days will be used if we miss a school day due to snow or ice. Please familiarize yourself with student‚Äôs responsibilities on AMI Days by visting the link below.

https://s3.amazonaws.com/scschoolfiles/1654/student_requirements_and_expectations_on_ami_days.pdf

If you have any questions, please contact your child‚Äôs school office.

post_text: The Poyen HIPPY Program is now accepting applications for a full time position to complete the 2018-2019 program year. The Homebased Educator will work with parents of 3 and 4 year old children. You must have dependable transportation to travel to the homes of the enrolled families. A Child Development Associate ( CDA) credential or higher is required. Please e-mail your resume to:crowlan@bryantschools.org Cindy Rowlan - 501-653-5611

post_text: Water line is fixed. Since pressure was not lost, we are not under a boil order. Poyen Elementary School
text: Water line is fixed. Since pressure was not lost, we are not under a boil order. Poyen Elementary School

post_text: The main water line that supplies water to Poyen from Malvern burst this morning. The elementary building does not have water, but the other buildings on campus get water from the water tower in Poyen. So the elementary students are able to use the restroom in other buildings. We are in contact with Malvern water and they are in the process of repairs. We intend to have school unless it is determined that repairs will not be completed in a timely manner. We'll keep you updated. Thank you

September 26, 2018 at 8:38 AM ¬∑

The 3rd-6th grade students will be bringing home a letter today explaining the Home Access Center(HAC). HAC is used by parents and students to check grades, attendance, and report cards online at any time. The letter has the steps to follow to set up your account. If you have any questions, please let us know.
